skill.name: ux-evaluator
skill.description: This skill should be used when evaluating UI components against UX best practices. Use for reviewing buttons, navigation elements, spacing, visual hierarchy, or any interface element. Provides a systematic 3-dimension framework (Position, Visual Weight, Spacing) aligned with industry standards (Balsamiq, Nielsen heuristics). Invoke when user asks to "review UX", "check button design", "evaluate layout", or references design guidelines.

security_audit.summary: Pure documentation skill containing only UX evaluation guidelines. No code execution, network calls, filesystem access, or external capabilities. Static findings are false positives: backticks are markdown delimiters, URLs are text references, and content hashes are metadata. The skill is a knowledge base for UX evaluation methodology.

content.user_title: Evaluate UI components against UX best practices
content.value_statement: UI reviews often devolve into subjective opinion battles. This skill provides a systematic 3-dimension framework to ground design feedback in evidence-based principles from industry authorities.
actual_capabilities: Evaluates UI components using the 3-dimension framework (Position, Visual Weight, Spacing)
Applies industry conventions from Balsamiq, Nielsen, and major platforms
Produces structured evaluation reports with clear verdicts
References authoritative sources for each recommendation
Prioritizes changes by UX impact (P1, P2, P3)
Analyzes buttons, navigation, and form elements
limitations: Does not evaluate colors, fonts, or purely aesthetic choices
Cannot access external websites or design files
Does not generate design mockups or prototypes
Does not perform user testing or accessibility audits

use_cases.title: Review button placement
use_cases.description: Validate that primary and secondary actions follow industry conventions like GitHub and Stripe patterns.

use_cases.title: Analyze navigation hierarchy
use_cases.description: Evaluate whether navigation elements are positioned and styled according to usability standards.

use_cases.title: Check form UX compliance
use_cases.description: Verify form elements follow proper spacing, labeling, and error state guidelines.

prompt_templates.title: Button review request
prompt_templates.prompt: Review the [submit/cancel] button placement in my form. Use the 3-dimension framework and compare to industry standards.

prompt_templates.title: Navigation assessment
prompt_templates.prompt: Evaluate my navigation bar elements including logo, links, and utility icons. Check position and visual weight against conventions.

prompt_templates.title: Form field analysis
prompt_templates.prompt: Analyze my form fields for label placement, error message positioning, and spacing between inputs. Reference Balsamiq guidelines.

prompt_templates.title: Full UI component audit
prompt_templates.prompt: Perform a complete UX evaluation of my [component name] using all three dimensions. Document current state, compare to conventions, and provide prioritized recommendations with sources.

best_practices: Always document the current state with specific measurements before making recommendations
Reference authoritative sources (Balsamiq, Nielsen, major platforms) for each recommendation
Prioritize P1 changes that break UX fundamentals over P3 polish improvements
anti_patterns: Making subjective aesthetic judgments without referencing UX principles
Recommending changes without comparing to industry conventions
Failing to distinguish between primary and secondary action hierarchy

faq.question: Does this skill evaluate accessibility (a11y)?
faq.answer: It checks touch target sizes (44px minimum) but does not perform full accessibility audits or screen reader testing.

faq.question: Can it analyze mockups or screenshots?
faq.answer: No. It evaluates based on descriptions provided in text. For visual analysis, describe component state and measurements.

faq.question: Which UX frameworks does it reference?
faq.answer: Primary sources include Balsamiq button principles, Nielsen heuristics, and patterns from GitHub, Stripe, and Google.

faq.question: Is data stored or transmitted?
faq.answer: No. This is a prompt-based skill that operates entirely in context with no external data access or storage.

faq.question: Can it generate design alternatives?
faq.answer: It provides recommendations for improvements but does not generate mockups, code, or visual design files.

faq.question: How is this different from general design feedback?
faq.answer: It uses a systematic 3-dimension framework and references documented conventions rather than subjective opinions.
